Metadata: Bird watching: what biologists are learning about avian behavior

Courtship, parenting, aggression, song, and population declines are some of the subjects being studied by biologists and bird enthusiasts in the Pacific Northwest region. This article takes a look at current research into the intelligence and instincts behind behavioral patterns in the lazuli bunting, murres, the brown-headed cowbird, prairie chickens, ptarmigan, and grouse.
